title: Tailwind CSS Installation - PostCSS
summary: Official Tailwind CSS docs explain using the @tailwindcss/postcss plugin to process Tailwind in PostCSS. Autoprefixer is built in so no extra configuration is needed.
relevant_claims: Use @tailwindcss/postcss in postcss.config.js
Autoprefixer is included with the plugin

title: @tailwindcss/postcss README
summary: Repository describes the @tailwindcss/postcss plugin providing a zero-config PostCSS plugin that bundles Tailwind CSS and autoprefixer.
relevant_claims: postcss.config.js uses {'@tailwindcss/postcss': {}}
Plugin includes Tailwind and autoprefixer

title: daisyUI Theme Tokens
summary: daisyUI exposes design tokens as CSS variables like --b1, --b2, --bc, --p, and --pf which can be used with hsl(var(--token)).
relevant_claims: Background colors use hsl(var(--b1)) and hsl(var(--b2))
Text color uses hsl(var(--bc))
Primary colors use --p and --pf

title: PrismJS Home
summary: PrismJS is a lightweight syntax highlighter that provides ready-made themes such as prism-tomorrow.css.
relevant_claims: Include prism-tomorrow.css for a dark theme

title: Eleventy Event Hooks
summary: Eleventy exposes event hooks such as `eleventy.before` and `eleventy.after` to run tasks before or after the build and serve process.
relevant_claims: Use `eleventy.before` to ensure assets like CSS are generated before the server starts

title: downwindcss/text-decoration
summary: Tailwind plugin providing text-decoration utilities like text-decoration-underline, text-decoration-dotted, and text-decoration-2.
relevant_claims: Classes prefixed with text-decoration-* for line, style, color, thickness

title: Eleventy Image Plugin
summary: Eleventy Image plugin provides an HTML Transform that rewrites tags into elements with multiple formats, configurable via formats, widths, urlPath, outputDir, and can process images on-request during development.
relevant_claims: HTML Transform rewrites images into <picture> with multiple <source> tags
urlPath and outputDir control URL and output directories
transformOnRequest enables image generation during --serve

title: Sharp Output Formats
summary: Sharp's output API supports modern formats like AVIF and WebP with alpha channel transparency and compression options.
relevant_claims: Supports AVIF and WebP output
Maintains transparency for PNG sources
Allows compression settings for optimized images

title: Can I Use AVIF
summary: Can I Use data shows AVIF image format is supported in current versions of Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Safari, representing broad modern browser coverage.
relevant_claims: AVIF supported in Chrome 85+, Firefox 93+, Edge 85+, Safari 16+

title: Can I Use WebP
summary: Can I Use data shows WebP image format is supported in all major browsers including Chrome, Edge, Firefox, and Safari, enabling safe usage as a fallback format.
relevant_claims: WebP supported in Chrome 32+, Edge 18+, Firefox 65+, Safari 14+

title: MDN Responsive Images
summary: MDN guidance explains using <picture>, srcset, and sizes attributes to deliver responsive images and provide format fallbacks.
relevant_claims: <picture> allows multiple sources for different formats
srcset and sizes enable responsive image selection by width

title: markdown-it-footnote README
summary: Official README for markdown-it-footnote plugin describing Pandoc-style footnote syntax for markdown-it.
relevant_claims: Adds Pandoc-style footnote references and definitions
Requires markdown-it v5+

title: Markdown Guide â€“ Footnotes
summary: Markdown Guide explains creating footnote references with caret notation and placing definitions elsewhere in the document.
relevant_claims: Footnote references use [^id] syntax
Definitions start with [^id]: followed by content

title: markdown-it demo
summary: markdown-it is a pluggable Markdown parser with customizable renderer rules.
relevant_claims: Plugins and renderer rules enable custom output

title: HTML Links - Bookmarks
summary: W3Schools shows creating bookmarks by adding id to elements and linking with href="#C4" to jump within the same page.
relevant_claims: Internal links use id attributes and fragment identifiers like href="#C4"

title: markdown-it-footnote index.mjs
summary: Plugin renders footnote references with href="#fn${id}" and backreferences linking to id="fnref${refid}".
relevant_claims: footnote_ref outputs <a href="#fn${id}" id="fnref${refid}">
footnote_anchor links back to id fnref${id}
